author: Michael Caines
method: Scrub and wash the new potatoes and place into a saucepan.  Cover with the water and then add the rest of the ingredients, except the butter and final seasoning. Bring to the boil and reduce to a simmer.  Cook for approximately 20 minutes.  Once cooked, drain and using a fork or a potato masher, crush the potatoes lightly, add the butter and season with salt and pepper.
ingredients: 400g/14oz Cornish new potatoes (if you cannot get Cornish use Jersey),  2L/3½pt water to cover ,  2 heads of garlic, cut in half,  2 large bay leaves ,  20 sprigs of thyme,  1 tsp chicken bouillon ,  40g/1½oz salt ,  100g/3½ unsalted butter ,  salt and pepper
